newsitem.title: INDIA: India overnight rates touch a low of 0.25-0.75 pct.
newsitem.headline: India overnight rates touch a low of 0.25-0.75 pct.

text.p: Call money was traded at low of 0.25-0.75 percent on Wednesday as banks continued to be flush with funds ahead of the reporting Friday, dealers said.
"Bonds have mopped up about 20 billion rupees - the collections are coming in," said a bank treasury manager.
He said the bond subscription may not have been factored in when the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announced repos auction. On Tuesday, the RBI announced a repos schedule for February.
The Industrial Development Bank alone is believed to have raised close to 15 billion rupees through a retail bond issue which closed subscription last week.
The new fortnight should see call rates in the band of 4.5-5.0 percent, dealers said.
